layer.name: Fellowship
layer.definition: Building relationships with friends who are on the journey with you; mutual investment, transparency, and sharpening. 'Two are better than one' (Ecclesiastes 4:9-12). 'Iron sharpens iron' (Proverbs 27:17).

questions.text: I have people who know how I'm really doing emotionally — not just the 'fine' I tell most people.
I can cry, rage, or despair in front of certain people without shame — they can hold my emotions.
I provide emotional presence for others — I can hold their hard emotions without fixing, fleeing, or freezing.
My emotional friendships challenge me to grow, not just comfort me in my patterns.
questions.principle: True fellowship transforms, not just supports

questions.text: I've shared my emotional history (pain, trauma, struggles) with people who've earned that trust.
